result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Langer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob James Langer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob James Langer was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with M.C., K.A. or their immediate families.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders. All prescriptions need to be approved by agent.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.

AODA treatment and aftercare.
Comply with all terms and conditions of Drug Treatment Court
